result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcy L. Miller

defendant.name: Miller, Marcy L.

records.addlTxt:
10:05 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Marcy L. Miller, appeared with Attorney Chad A Shamali.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance. Attorney Shamali advises the Court that he received an offer, but there is not an agreement between the parties. Attorney Shamali is requesting the matter be set for jury trial. Attorney Shamali given scheduling order in court. Jury status hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from the court re: Judicial Rotation

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne and Attorney Daniel Deida appeared for the State. Attorney Chad A Shamali in court with Defendant Marcy L. Miller.  Clerk: PT  
  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Clerk JT  Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days;  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:15 am. Bond continued posted w/ same conditions (see bond entry). mi
